effects.text: This spell has the same properties as the spell
Unseen Servant

, but grants the servant a semblance of intelligence and skill. The servant has a Dexterity and Wisdom of 10, and adds your spellcasting ability modifier to any Strength, Dexterity, or Wisdom check it makes. It cannot make ability checks with ability scores it does not have. The servant can hear and understand any question you mentally ask of it, and it can respond telepathically in a one-word whisper audible only to you.

name: Whispering Servant
components: V, S, M (a short piece of copper wire and a tin cup)

effects.text: You create a toxic rain cloud over a point you can see within range, provided there is 5 feet of unoccupied space above that point. Until the spell ends, the cloud rains acid in a 5-foot cube beneath it. Any creature in the rain's space when you cast the spell must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take
acid damage. A creature takes 1 point of acid damage if it ends its turn in the rain's space. The cloud stops raining and disappears at the beginning of your next turn.

when cast and 1 additional point for creatures ending their turn within the space when you reach 5th level (
and 2), 11th level (

You create a zone that prevents mortal wounds for safe dueling. Choose any number of willing humanoids within range that can hear and understand you to be affected. When the spell ends, all creatures affected by the spell regain any hit points lost from damage dealt by other creatures under the effect of the spell. The spell ends early if a creature yields or is reduced to 0 hit points. The spell also ends early if an affected creature damages an unaffected creature, or an unaffected creature damages an affected one. A creature that dies by damage dealt by another creature under this spell is instead reduced to 0 hit points and is stable.

name: Spar
components: V, S, M (a small white flag)

effects.text: You attempt to see glimpses into the immediate future of a creature you can see, as long as it remains within range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw, which it can willingly fail. If the creature has an Intelligence score of 6 or lower, it automatically succeeds. On a failed save, you gain sight of their intentions and steal time to react accordingly. During the creature's turn, you gain the following benefits:
- You can move up to your speed during the creature's turn by moving in tandem. For every 5 feet the creature moves, you can also move 5 feet.
- You know what action and bonus action the creature will take, along with its targets, just before it happens.

- Before the creature uses its action or bonus action, you can expend your reaction to use any remaining movement you haven't used during the creature's turn and take an action or bonus action. Once the creature has chosen its action, it cannot change any part of that action (such as targets or direction), no matter how you respond.

Regardless of the spell lasting for its duration, as long as the creature failed its saving throw, the stolen time pulls you back into its normal flow. On your next turn you must take only an action, a bonus action, or move exclusively.

name: Synchronization
components: V, S, M (a necklace of glass beads)

effects.text: A 30 foot radius sphere of wrenching momentum focuses at a point on the ground you can see within range, the very center of which is a pitch black wormhole. When you cast this spell, you must also choose another unoccupied space on solid ground within 1000 feet that you have seen, which becomes the wormhole's exit.
Until the end of your next turn, a creature within the sphere that moves away from the center takes

force damage for every 5 feet it moves. If a creature ends its turn within the sphere, it is pulled into the central wormhole and must make a Strength saving throw. On a failure, the creature is teleported to the wormhole's exit. A creature can willingly fail this saving throw. Unsecured objects of size Medium or smaller are pulled along with any creatures.

name: Gravitational Well
components: V, S, M (two rings of black granite)

effects.text: You coerce an amount of matter that fits within a 5-foot cube to quake at a molecular level. You manipulate it in one of the following ways:

- If you touch an area of hardened earth, stone, wood, or ice, you can cause it to slowly dry and crack apart. If you target a construct, elemental, or plant made of this material, you must make a melee spell attack to make contact. Upon touch, that area or creature takes an amount of bludgeoning damage equal to your level.

- If you touch an area of loose dirt, sand, or soil on the ground, you can soften the surface and make it difficult terrain. If you continue to repeat this in the same spot on subsequent turns, the affected surface area increases by 5 feet radially. You can increase the size a number of times equal to your spellcasting ability modifier. The change lasts for 10 minutes from the initial casting. Using this again in a different location ends any previous effect.
- If you touch an area of ice, you can melt it into liquid. The liquid refreezes at its own pace if conditions provide.
- You can make any beverage held in your hand pleasantly warm to drink.

Choose three constructs or inanimate nonmagical objects you can see within 30 feet of you when you cast this spell. You imbue them with the similitude of thought and speech, giving them the ability to communicate with you. You can question the objects about events in the spell's area within the past hour, gaining information about creatures that have passed through, a vague description of any items the object may contain, and other related circumstances.

Objects and constructs might be able to perform other tasks on your behalf, but they remain unchanged and nonliving, and if lacking locomotion, they are unable to carry out any services. Even if able, any request is subject to the whim of the target. A hostile construct, one in service to another master, or an object held dear to another person may be reluctant to help, whereas inanimate furnishings are generally happy to oblige.
If you choose a creature that is disguised as an inanimate object, it is immediately exposed as a creature to you.

You override the mental instincts of another creature within range. The target must succeed a Wisdom saving throw or become linked with you. A creature can automatically succeed if it is immune to being charmed, though any creature can willingly fail this saving throw. While linked, the creature gains advantage on saving throws against being charmed, frightened, and stunned.
Also, choose either Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma when you cast the spell. The linked creature uses your saving throw bonus instead of their own for saving throws made with the chosen ability.
On each of your turns for the duration, you must use your action to continue the link. The spell ends if you use your action to do anything else.

You create an exact and indiscernible replica of any object you have seen that can fit within a 10 foot cube. If the object was magical or had complex mechanical workings, the new object appears to have those same properties, but it does not work if used. Only the object’s original creator can tell it is a fake on sight with a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC. Any creature attempting to use the object can make the same check to determine if the object is fake.

name: Facsimile
components: V, S, M (the fragment of a color pool worth at least 5,000 gp)

effects.text: You send an ally and enemy into a mental battle. Choose one willing creature other than yourself and another creature that is hostile to the first, both of which must be within range and visible to you. If either creature resists or is immune to psychic damage, the spell fails. If the hostile creature fails a Wisdom saving throw, both creatures are temporarily sent to a harmless demiplane standing 30 feet apart from one another on solid ground. They both roll initiative, then each take one turn in that order. All damage dealt during this time is converted to psychic damage. The spell ends after both turns have been taken. Both creatures are returned to the space they disappeared from, though it appears as if they never left.

name: Psychic Clash
components: V, S, M (a prism of electrum worth at least 50 gp, which the spell consumes)

effects.text: The brilliance of a star explodes sunlight out from a point 100 feet directly above you. The spell fails if you can't see a point in the air where the light could appear (for example, if you are in a room without 100 feet of space above). The light fills a 1000 foot cube centered on the point the spell was cast, and dispels any darkness that was created by a spell.
When you cast the spell and at the beginning of each of your turns for its duration, roll a
d6
. The spell then affects all creatures within its light that are not behind total cover, are of a CR equal to or lower than the rolled value, and have one or more of the following traits:
- The creature is undead.
- The creature is an ooze.
- The creature is naturally resistant or immune to cold damage.
- The creature is naturally resistant or immune to necrotic damage.
- The creature is naturally vulnerable to fire or radiant damage and is not a plant.
If an affected creature has 10 hit points or fewer, it dies and is reduced to dust. Otherwise, an affected creature loses half of its current hit points.

name: Incandescence
components: V, S, M (a piece of meteorite)

effects.text: The cryptic words of a spell scroll you hold become meaningful to you. When you cast this spell, it is automatically cast at the level of the scroll's spell. If the scroll's spell is of a higher level than you can normally cast, you cannot cast this spell upon the scroll. If this spell is successful, you are able to attempt to use the spell scroll, regardless if the spell is on your class's spell list.

You become elusive and slippery for a brief moment. As part of the bonus action used to cast this spell, you can immediately repeat an ability check or saving throw needed to end the grappled or restrained condition on yourself with a
bonus to the roll.
At Higher Levels.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the bonus increases by 1 for each slot level above 1st.

The terrain in a 10 foot square centered on a point within range becomes pliable and bouncy until the end of your next turn. A Large or smaller creature that jumps while standing on that space has its jump distance tripled. A Medium or smaller creature that falls on that space has its falling damage halved.

name: Rubberize
components: V, S, M (a ball of tar and a sling)

effects.text: A spectral mirror of ever-changing shape appears for the duration at a space you can see within range. When you cast this spell, you can mentally designate any number of creatures. Only those creatures are able to see the mirror. The mirror reflects a clear and separate image of all creatures within 20 feet of it, regardless of visibility and cover. As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the mirror up to 20 feet.

A creature that can see the mirror can choose to make ranged attacks at a reflection of a creature in the mirror, so long as the creature they would be targeting is within range. The attacks bounce off the mirror and aim towards the intended target, bypassing cover granted by terrain.

name: Speculum
components: V, S, M (a polished sphere of steel and a pinch of powdered silver)

effects.text: You disrupt the control that a spellcaster has over a creature. Make an ability check using your spellcasting ability, with a bonus equal to the level at which this spell was cast. The DC equals 8 + the triggering spell's level. On a success, for the duration of the triggering spell the charmed or summoned creature is also under the effect of the spell
confusion
with the following alterations:
- On a roll of 7-8, the creature defaults to the triggering spell's effects.
- On a roll of 9-10, the creature is instead charmed by you for that turn.
If you succeed your spellcasting ability check by 5 or more, the creature that cast the triggering spell is unaware of your interference in their spell's effects.

name: Addlespell
castingtime: 1 reaction, which you take when a creature you can see within 60 feet is charmed or summoned by a spell

effects.text: You create a ward of rebounding energy to protect creatures against a spell. Choose a number of creatures equal to the level at which this spell was cast that you can see within range. They can add your spellcasting ability bonus to their failed saving throw against the triggering spell, possibly causing a creature to succeed.

Each time this spell turns a saving throw failure into a success, the creature that cast the triggering spell must make a spellcasting ability check against your spell save DC. On a failure, the creature falls prone. If the creature fails its check by 5 or more, it ends its concentration on any spells it was casting.

name: Hedgespell
castingtime: 1 reaction, which you take when creatures you can see within 60 feet fail a saving throw against a spell

effects.text: You attempt to reflect back a portion destructive magic. Roll a number of
d4

equal to 1 plus the level at which this spell was cast. The triggering spell's damage is reduced by the rolled amount. If the spell has multiple types or sources of damage, each type or source is reduced by that amount. This effect cannot reduce the damage of a spell past zero, nor can it negate any other effects of a spell.

After reducing the spell's damage, make a ranged spell attack against the creature that cast the triggering spell. On a hit, the creature takes force damage equal to half the reduced amount (the highest from one source).

name: Turnspell
castingtime: 1 reaction, which you take when a spell deals damage to creatures you can see within 60 feet

effects.text: You attempt to interrupt a spellcaster by severing the magical tethers left behind by their spell. Choose a creature that you could see and was within range when it had cast its spell. It must succeed a spellcasting ability check against your spell save DC. On a failure, that creature cannot cast that spell again for a number of rounds equal to half the level this spell was cast at, rounded down. If the creature is concentrating on that spell, it has disadvantage on Constitution saving throws made to maintain concentration during those rounds. Additionally, if the triggering creature's spell teleported them away from their previous location, they are instantly teleported back to where they began casting the spell.

name: Severspell
castingtime: 1 reaction, which you take immediately after you have seen a creature within 60 feet of you cast a spell
